definition[0]: the crime of using secret information that you have about a company, or knowledge of a situation, to buy or sell shares at a profit
definition[1]: when someone uses knowledge of a particular company, situation etc that is not available to other people in order to buy or sell shares. Insider trading is illegal
example[0]: Shares in both banks jumped 20% two weeks before confirmation of their merger, which led to an insider trading inquiry being opened.
